Description: Rim fragment from North Ionian large high-domed pottery lid with flange. Bars on edge of rim, hook maeanders on top. On top, from centre: broad band: dots; band; lotus and bud chain; band; shallow grooves at either side of dot frieze. Underside reserved. Beige pink clay with some lime, little large mica, some vegetal inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 225, no. 121)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 113, pl. XXXV, no. 324.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1026)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no 962, pl. 109)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4713 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
